summary.para: Represents the empty array. This field is read-only.

member.name: T:UltimateOrb.Boolean8

summary.para: Represents a Boolean (true or false) value. Internally, this type uses 8-bit representations.
This type can handle non-canonical representations (values other than 0 or 1).

member.remarks:
This type is blittable.
The size of a value of this type is the same as sizeof(byte).

member.name: T:UltimateOrb.Boolean32

summary.para: Represents a Boolean (true or false) value. Internally, this type uses an integer (/).

This type can handle non-canonical representations (values other than 0 or 1).
See for a boolean type that handles canonical representations only but may have better performance.

member.remarks:
This type is blittable.
The size of a value of this type is the same as sizeof(int).

member.name: T:UltimateOrb.CanonicalIntegerBoolean

summary.para: Represents a Boolean (true or false) value. Internally, this type uses an integer (/).

The internal representation of this boolean type is assumed to be canonical (0 for false and 1 for true) and remains so. Breaking this invariant may cause undefined behavior.
See for a boolean type that handles non-canonical representations.

member.remarks:
This type is blittable.
The size of a value of this type is the same as sizeof(int).

Represents a variable size last-in-first-out (LIFO) collection of instances of the same specified type. This type is a value type.

typeparam.para: Specifies the type of elements in the stack.

remarks.para: Value assignments of the have move semantics.

summary.para: Initializes a new instance of the type that is empty and has an initial capacity at least the value specified.

member.name: F:UltimateOrb.FloatingPointRounding.ToOdd
member.summary: The sticky rounding, a.k.a. rounding to odd.
member.remarks: In binary arithmetic, this rounding is to round the result toward zero, and set the least significant bit to 1 if the rounded result is inexact. Equivalently, it consists in returning the intermediate result when it is exactly representable, and the nearest floating-point number with an odd significand otherwise.

summary.para: Parses a signed integer.

remarks.para: The Number must be in format [1-9][0-9]*.

member.name: M:UltimateOrb.Numerics.BigIntegerWrappers.BigIntegerExtensions.GetBitLength(System.Numerics.BigInteger)
member.summary: Gets the number of bits required for shortest two's complement representation of the current instance without the sign bit.
member.returns: The minimum non-negative number of bits in two's complement notation without the sign bit.
member.remarks: This method returns 0 iff the value of current object is equal to or . For positive integers the return value is equal to the ordinary binary representation string length.

summary.para: Provides double precision operations of and and other operations to support longer numeric data types.
Computes the absolute value of the specified value of a signed operand with double-precision data. The result is an unsigned value with double-precision data.

param.name: value_lo
param.para: The lo bits of the double-precision data of the operand.

param.name: value_hi
param.para: The hi bits of the double-precision data of the operand.

param.name: result_hi
param.para: The hi bits of the double-precision data of the result.

returns.para: The lo bits of the double-precision data of the result.

summary.para: Computes the bit pattern of the next permutation in the lexicographical order. If the current permutation is already the maximum, the result will be the pattern with all bits 1.

param.name: lo
param.para: The lo part of the current bit pattern.

param.name: hi
param.para: The hi part of the current bit pattern.

param.name: result_hi
param.para: The hi part of the next bit pattern.

returns.para: The lo part of the next bit pattern.

summary.para: Adds the specified values of two operands with double-precision data. If the result can not be represented in regard to the precision of the destination, no exception will be thrown and the result will be truncated, ignoring the bits beyond the precision.

param.name: first_lo
param.para: The lo bits of the double-precision data of the first operand.

param.name: first_hi
param.para: The hi bits of the double-precision data of the first operand.

param.name: second_lo
param.para: The lo bits of the double-precision data of the second operand.

param.name: second_hi
param.para: The hi bits of the double-precision data of the second operand.

param.name: result_hi
param.para: The hi bits of the double-precision data of the result.

returns.para: The lo bits of the double-precision data of the result.

remarks.para: Of this operation, the sign interpretations of the operands do not matter and both signed and unsigned versions yield the same results.

summary.para: Adds the specified values of two signed operands with double-precision data. If the result can not be represented in regard to the precision of the destination, will be thrown.

param.name: first_lo
param.para: The lo bits of the double-precision data of the first operand.

param.name: first_hi
param.para: The hi bits of the double-precision data of the first operand.

param.name: second_lo
param.para: The lo bits of the double-precision data of the second operand.

param.name: second_hi
param.para: The hi bits of the double-precision data of the second operand.

param.name: result_hi
param.para: The hi bits of the double-precision data of the result.

returns.para: The lo bits of the double-precision data of the result.

remarks.para: The operands of this operation are interpreted as signed operands regardless of the sign interpretations implied from their signatures.

summary.para: Adds the specified values of two unsigned operands with double-precision data. If the result can not be represented in regard to the precision of the destination, will be thrown.

param.name: first_lo
param.para: The lo bits of the double-precision data of the first operand.

param.name: first_hi
param.para: The hi bits of the double-precision data of the first operand.

param.name: second_lo
param.para: The lo bits of the double-precision data of the second operand.

param.name: second_hi
param.para: The hi bits of the double-precision data of the second operand.

param.name: result_hi
param.para: The hi bits of the double-precision data of the result.

returns.para: The lo bits of the double-precision data of the result.

remarks.para: The operands of this operation are interpreted as unsigned operands regardless of the sign interpretations implied from their signatures.

summary.para: Subtracts the value of one operand with double-precision data from the value of another operand with double-precision data and returns the result. If the result can not be represented in regard to the precision of the destination, no exception will be thrown and the result will be truncated, ignoring the bits beyond the precision.

param.name: first_lo
param.para: The lo bits of the double-precision data of the first operand.

param.name: first_hi
param.para: The hi bits of the double-precision data of the first operand.

param.name: second_lo
param.para: The lo bits of the double-precision data of the second operand.

param.name: second_hi
param.para: The hi bits of the double-precision data of the second operand.

param.name: result_hi
param.para: The hi bits of the double-precision data of the result.

returns.para: The lo bits of the double-precision data of the result.

remarks.para: Of this operation, the sign interpretations of the operands do not matter and both signed and unsigned versions yield the same results.

summary.para: Subtracts the value of one signed operand with double-precision data from the value of another signed operand with double-precision data and returns the result. If the result can not be represented in regard to the precision of the destination, will be thrown.

param.name: first_lo
param.para: The lo bits of the double-precision data of the first operand.

param.name: first_hi
param.para: The hi bits of the double-precision data of the first operand.

param.name: second_lo
param.para: The lo bits of the double-precision data of the second operand.

param.name: second_hi
param.para: The hi bits of the double-precision data of the second operand.

param.name: result_hi
param.para: The hi bits of the double-precision data of the result.

returns.para: The lo bits of the double-precision data of the result.

remarks.para: The operands of this operation are interpreted as signed operands regardless of the sign interpretations implied from their signatures.

summary.para: Subtracts the value of one unsigned operand with double-precision data from the value of another unsigned operand with double-precision data and returns the result. If the result can not be represented in regard to the precision of the destination, will be thrown.

param.name: first_lo
param.para: The lo bits of the double-precision data of the first operand.

param.name: first_hi
param.para: The hi bits of the double-precision data of the first operand.

param.name: second_lo
param.para: The lo bits of the double-precision data of the second operand.

param.name: second_hi
param.para: The hi bits of the double-precision data of the second operand.

param.name: result_hi
param.para: The hi bits of the double-precision data of the result.

returns.para: The lo bits of the double-precision data of the result.

remarks.para: The operands of this operation are interpreted as unsigned operands regardless of the sign interpretations implied from their signatures.

summary.para: Multiplies the specified values of two operands with double-precision data. If the result can not be represented in regard to the precision of the destination, no exception will be thrown and the result will be truncated, ignoring the bits beyond the precision.

summary.para: Multiplies the specified values of two signed operands with double-precision data. If the result can not be represented in regard to the precision of the destination, will be thrown.

summary.para: Multiplies the specified values of two operands with double-precision data. If the result can not be represented in regard to the precision of the destination, no exception will be thrown and the result will be truncated, ignoring the bits beyond the precision.

param.name: first_lo
param.para: The lo bits of the double-precision data of the first operand.

param.name: first_hi
param.para: The hi bits of the double-precision data of the first operand.

param.name: second_lo
param.para: The lo bits of the double-precision data of the second operand.

param.name: second_hi
param.para: The hi bits of the double-precision data of the second operand.

param.name: result_hi
param.para: The hi bits of the double-precision data of the result.

returns.para: The lo bits of the double-precision data of the result.

remarks.para: Of this operation, the sign interpretations of the operands do not matter and both signed and unsigned versions yield the same results.

summary.para: Multiplies the specified values of two signed operands with double-precision data. If the result can not be represented in regard to the precision of the destination, will be thrown.

param.name: first_lo
param.para: The lo bits of the double-precision data of the first operand.

param.name: first_hi
param.para: The hi bits of the double-precision data of the first operand.

param.name: second_lo
param.para: The lo bits of the double-precision data of the second operand.

param.name: second_hi
param.para: The hi bits of the double-precision data of the second operand.

param.name: result_hi
param.para: The hi bits of the double-precision data of the result.

returns.para: The lo bits of the double-precision data of the result.

remarks.para: The operands of this operation are interpreted as signed operands regardless of the sign interpretations implied from their signatures.

summary.para: Multiplies the specified values of two unsigned operands with double-precision data. If the result can not be represented in regard to the precision of the destination, will be thrown.

param.name: first_lo
param.para: The lo bits of the double-precision data of the first operand.

param.name: first_hi
param.para: The hi bits of the double-precision data of the first operand.

param.name: second_lo
param.para: The lo bits of the double-precision data of the second operand.

param.name: second_hi
param.para: The hi bits of the double-precision data of the second operand.

param.name: result_hi
param.para: The hi bits of the double-precision data of the result.

returns.para: The lo bits of the double-precision data of the result.

remarks.para: The operands of this operation are interpreted as unsigned operands regardless of the sign interpretations implied from their signatures.

summary.para: Returns the square root of the specified value of an operand with double-precision data.

param.name: lo
param.para: The lo bits of the double-precision data of the operand.

param.name: hi
param.para: The hi bits of the double-precision data of the operand.

returns.para: The square root.

remarks.para: The result is rounded towards zero.

summary.para: Returns the square root of a specified value of an operand with double-precision data.

param.name: lo
param.para: The lo bits of the radicand.

param.name: hi
param.para: The hi bits of the radicand.

returns.para: The square root.

summary.para: Returns the square root of a specified number.

param.name: radicand
param.para: The radicand.

returns.para:
The truncated (upto double precision) value of the positive square root of ; that is, (of the return value)
the higher half: the integral part of the square root -and-
the lower half: the fractional part of the square root.

summary.para: Provides static methods for getting the managed size of the specified type.

devdoc.para: This type contains members will be modified by the build tools. The build tools identify the type and those members by their names. Whenever you rename this type or such a member, update the build tools accordingly.

summary.para: Represents the number of bits in a byte.
Returns the bit size of the specified type.

returns.para: The managed size, in bits, of a type.

remarks.para: For a reference type, the size returned is the size of the object reference itself (same as sizeof(IntPtr)), not the actural size of the data stored in the object.

devdoc.para: ECMA-335: Note that the runtime size of a value type shall not exceed 1 MiB (0x100000 bytes).

summary.para: Returns the result of the CIL sizeof instruction of the specified type.

typeparam.name: T
typeparam.para: Specifies the type parameter of the instruction.

returns.para: The managed size, in bytes, of a type.

remarks.para: For a reference type, the size returned is the size of the object reference itself (same as sizeof(IntPtr)), not the actural size of the data stored in the object.

devdoc.para: ECMA-335: Note that the runtime size of a value type shall not exceed 1 MiB (0x100000 bytes).
The body of this method will be modified by the build tools. The build tools identify the method by its names. Whenever you rename this method, update the build tools accordingly.
